required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Study of HIF-1α in Cirrhosis by Fecal Microbiota Transplantation

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with cirrhosis were recruitted and divided into cintrol group and FMT group. Patients in FMT group were carried by fecal microbiota transplantation, and biochemical indexes, intestinal flora and intestinal HIF expression were observed before and after FMT respectively.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline blood ammonia at 12 months
Change from baseline alanine aminotransferase at 12 months
Change from baseline aspartate aminotransferase at 12 months
Change from baseline gut microbiome at 12 months
Change from baseline white blood cell at 12 months
Change from baseline hemoglobin at 12 months
Change from baseline blood platelet at 12 months
Change from baseline albumin at 12 months
Change from baseline blood glucose at 12 months
Change from baseline serum creatinine at 12 months
Change from baseline direct bilirubin at 12 months
Change from baseline indirect bilirubin at 12 months
Change from baseline prothrombin time activity percentage at 12 months
Change from baseline liver stiffness at 12 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline HIF-1α expression in intestine at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of HIF-1α expression in intestine by western blot

arm_group.description: Patients were carried by fecal microbiota transplantation which described in detail that fecal bacteria are extracted from the faeces of healthy people and poured into the intestines of patients.

intervention.description: Fecal bacteria liquid were obtained from healthy people by a feces processor, and perfused into the patient's intestine.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

results_reference.citation: Sung CM, Lin YF, Chen KF, Ke HM, Huang HY, Gong YN, Tsai WS, You JF, Lu MJ, Cheng HT, Lin CY, Kuo CJ, Tsai IJ, Hsieh SY. Predicting Clinical Outcomes of Cirrhosis Patients With Hepatic Encephalopathy From the Fecal Microbiome. Cell Mol Gastroenterol Hepatol. 2019;8(2):301-318.e2. doi: 10.1016/j.jcmgh.2019.04.008. Epub 2019 Apr 18.
